location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.123 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to an agreement made between Syed Soweynee [Thuwaini bin Said], Sultan of Muscat, and representatives of Abdullah ben Fysul [Abdullah bin Faisal] of the Wahhabi forces. Kemball writes that representatives of the Imam indicate that 15,000 dollars have been paid to Abdullah bin Faisal, although Kemball's own intelligence from the Shargah Agent Hajee Yacoob suggest the figure is 28,000 dollars. Kemball finishes by stating that the Arab chiefs have returned to their ports, and that he will set off to visit them immediately.
